paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: predominant polyneuropathy of early adult onset

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Specifically, patients affected by the p.Val50Met TTR variant experienced progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Specifically, patients affected by the p.Val50Met TTR variant experienced progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Specifically, patients affected by the p.Val50Met TTR variant experienced progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Specifically, patients affected by the p.Val50Met TTR variant experienced progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities.

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Specifically, patients affected by the p.Val50Met TTR variant experienced progressive sensorimotor disturbances, involving mainly the lower extremities.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val50Met variant is associated with a consistent phenotype characterized by predominant polyneuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The p.Val50Met variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was found in 6 unrelated families.
key_quotes: The most prevalent TTR variant detected was p.Val50Met, affecting 19 patients.
All patients had a positive family history of polyneuropathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: congestive heart failure and associated with peripheral neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The second most frequent TTR variant was p.Val114Ala, found in 10 patients (4 female patients, 6 male patients) who were affected at an older age.

individual_records.phenotype_details: congestive heart failure and associated with peripheral neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The second most frequent TTR variant was p.Val114Ala, found in 10 patients (4 female patients, 6 male patients) who were affected at an older age.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val114Ala variant is associated with a predominantly cardiomyopathic phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: The p.Val114Ala variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was found in 5 different families.
key_quotes: The second most frequent TTR variant was p.Val114Ala, found in 10 patients.
This variant caused a predominantly cardiomyopathic phenotype.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The third TTR variant (p.Arg54Gly) was found in a 50-year-old male patient with ophthalmopathy due to vitreous opacities.

functional_data.summary: The p.Arg54Gly variant is associated with ocular amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The p.Arg54Gly variant does not have segregation data available.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a positive family history for visual loss.
key_quotes: The third TTR variant (p.Arg54Gly) was found in a 50-year-old male patient with ophthalmopathy due to vitreous opacities.

tables_processed.table_caption: Comparison of Patients Carrying the p.Val50Met, the p.Val114Ala, and the p.Arg54Gly TTR Variants, Respectively

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
